top_rare_diseases.description: A kidney disorder characterized by excessive excretion of protein in the urine, leading to complications such as edema and high blood pressure.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of symptoms due to kidney damage. This includes proteinuria, hypoalbuminemia, and edema.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Nephrotic syndrome is a significant condition that can progress to chronic kidney disease and end-stage renal disease if left untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Glomerular diseases (e.g., minimal change disease, focal segmental glomerulosclerosis), infections, drugs, systemic diseases (e.g., lupus)
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Urine tests (proteinuria, hematuria), blood tests (serum albumin, cholesterol), kidney biopsy
top_rare_diseases.treatment: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, diuretics, dietary modifications
clinical_trials: Trial of Spironolactone in Nephrotic Syndrome (ClinicalTrials.gov)
Efficacy of Rituximab in Steroid-Resistant Nephrotic Syndrome (ClinicalTrials.gov)
key_aspects: Excessive proteinuria
Edema and hypoalbuminemia
Associated with various glomerular and systemic diseases
Requires immunosuppressive therapy in steroid-resistant cases

top_rare_diseases.description: A kidney disease characterized by the deposition of IgA antibodies in the glomeruli, leading to inflammation and kidney damage.
top_rare_diseases.overview: IgA Nephropathy, also known as Berger's disease, is the most common cause of kidney disease worldwide and can progress to chronic kidney disease.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: IgA Nephropathy can lead to end-stage renal disease in some patients, requiring dialysis or kidney transplantation.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Deposition of IgA antibodies in the kidneys, genetic predisposition, infections, mucosal infections
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Urine tests (blood and protein in urine), blood tests (IgA levels), kidney biopsy
top_rare_diseases.treatment: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, tonsillectomy in some cases
clinical_trials: Trial of Omega-3 Fatty Acids in IgA Nephropathy (ClinicalTrials.gov)
Efficacy of Rituximab in IgA Nephropathy (ClinicalTrials.gov)
key_aspects: deposition of IgA in glomeruli
Often presents with hematuria following upper respiratory infections
Variable prognosis, with some progressing to ESRD
Treatments focus on reducing proteinuria and inflammation

top_rare_diseases.description: A genetic disorder characterized by glomerulonephritis, end-stage kidney disease, and hearing loss.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Alport Syndrome is a hereditary disease caused by mutations in type IV collagen genes, leading to progressive kidney disease and hearing loss.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Alport Syndrome is a progressive disease that often leads to end-stage renal disease and hearing loss.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Genetic mutations in COL4A3, COL4A4, COL4A5 genes
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Family history, urine tests, blood tests, genetic testing, kidney biopsy
top_rare_diseases.treatment: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, management of chronic kidney disease, dialysis, kidney transplantation
clinical_trials: Trial of Anti-TGF-β Therapy in Alport Syndrome (ClinicalTrials.gov)
Efficacy of ACE Inhibitors in Slowing Progression (ClinicalTrials.gov)
key_aspects: Genetic disorder with family history
Associated with hearing loss and eye abnormalities
Progressive kidney disease leading to ESRD
No specific cure, management focuses on slowing progression

top_rare_diseases.description: A kidney disease characterized by the thickening of the glomerular basement membrane, leading to proteinuria and kidney damage.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Membranous Nephropathy is an immune-mediated disease that can be primary (idiopathic) or secondary to other conditions.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Membranous Nephropathy can progress to chronic kidney disease and end-stage renal disease if untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Autoimmune causes (antibodies to PLA2R), secondary to infections, drugs, systemic diseases (e.g., lupus)
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Urine tests (proteinuria), blood tests (antibodies), kidney biopsy
top_rare_diseases.treatment: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, Rituximab, dietary modifications
clinical_trials: Trial of Rituximab in Membranous Nephropathy (ClinicalTrials.gov)
key_aspects: Primary or secondary causes
Presence of antibodies to PLA2R in idiopathic cases
Variable response to immunosuppressive therapy
Relapses are common after initial treatment

top_rare_diseases.description: A complication of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) affecting the kidneys and leading to inflammation and damage.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Lupus Nephritis is a common and serious complication of SLE, leading to kidney inflammation and potential organ failure.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Lupus Nephritis is a major predictor of poor outcomes in SLE patients, necessitating prompt treatment.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Autoimmune response, immune complex deposition in kidneys
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Urine tests (proteinuria, hematuria), blood tests (ANAs, complement levels), kidney biopsy
top_rare_diseases.treatment: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants (e.g., cyclophosphamide, mycophenolate), hydroxychloroquine, ACE inhibitors
clinical_trials: Trial of Belimumab in Lupus Nephritis (ClinicalTrials.gov)
Efficacy of Voclosporin in Lupus Nephritis (ClinicalTrials.gov)
key_aspects: Associated with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
Immune complex deposition in kidneys
Requires aggressive immunosuppressive therapy
Regular monitoring for disease flare-ups and kidney function
